meanings.sent1: The pitchier road had a sticky feel underfoot.
meanings.sent2: The pitchier substance was difficult to remove from my hands.
meanings.sent3: The pitchier surface made the ball bounce unpredictably.
meanings.sent4: Her voice had a pitchier tone when she spoke about her favorite topic.
meanings.sent5: The pitchier smell of the pine forest lingered in the air.

meanings.definition: Having a darker or more intense color.
meanings.sent1: The pitchier shade of blue stood out against the lighter hues.
meanings.sent2: Her hair looked pitchier under the bright sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The pitchier paint color made the room feel cozy and warm.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds grew pitchier as the evening approached.
meanings.sent5: The pitchier sky at night was dotted with twinkling stars.

meanings.definition: More inclined or likely to pitch.
meanings.sent1: The pitchier boat struggled to stay steady in the rough waters.
meanings.sent2: The pitchier team had a higher chance of winning the game.
meanings.sent3: The pitchier pitcher had a tendency to throw curveballs.
meanings.sent4: Her mood became pitchier as the deadline approached.
meanings.sent5: The pitchier road was prone to causing cars to swerve.
